text: Benjamin Richard Civiletti (born July 17, 1935) is an American politician. He was the United States Attorney General during the last year and a half of the Carter administration, from 1979 to 1981. He was the first Italian American to serve as Attorney General. Since 2001, Civiletti is one of the three members of the Independent Review Board, a board that the International Brotherhood of Teamsters union must answer to when allegations of corruption or organized crime.The Independent Review Board . ==References== Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:United States Attorneys General Category:Politicians from New York City Category:People from Peekskill, New York Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States Deputy Attorneys General Category:Lawyers from New York City
